name: setValue
shortDescription: Sets the value of a device variable
description: This method sets the value of a device variable. Note that it can't be used to set configuration parameters.
signatures: Void setValue(Integer peerId, Integer channel, String variableName, Variant value)
Void setValue(Integer peerId, Integer channel, String variableName, Variant value, Boolean, wait)

parameters.name: peerId
parameters.description: The ID of the peer to set the value for or "0" to set or create a system variable.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel of the peer to set the value for or "-1" to set or create a metadata or system variable.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
The new value of the variable. Please make sure the passed variable has the correct type (for languages with implied type conversions "21.0" for Float and not "21"). When the type of the variable is Float or Integer, instead of passing the actual new value, you can also pass the following operations, followed without space by a number. The type of the value needs to be String:
  • "+="
  • "-="
  • "*="
  • "/="
  • "!"
"!" toggles a Boolean value and doesn't need to be followed by number. You don't have to check for minimum or maximum values, as the new value will automatically be capped. Example value: "+=0.5"

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Set to "false" if you don't want to wait for a response from the device. By default Homegear waits for a response when possible and returns an error when there is none. In some device families setting "wait" to "false" has no effect.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The serial number and channel of the device to set the value for (separated by a colon)
